12a5a61c0e6dd55f.title: Business Analyst Release Testing & Verification - Central Standard Time
12a5a61c0e6dd55f.desc:
This is where you save and sustain lives  
 
 At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You’ll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients. 
 
  Baxter’s products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare. 
 
  Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work. 
 
  Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives— where your purpose accelerates our mission. 
 
  Your Role At Baxter! 
 
  This dynamic role, in the healthcare software and medical device industry, is pivotal within Baxter Care Solutions. The Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for analyzing and evaluating business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending solutions that improve efficiency, productivity, and profitability. The BA works closely with stakeholders to understand their business needs and translate them into functional requirements that can be implemented by IT teams. 
 
  The Business Analyst - Release Testing & Verification role will focus on supporting our technical intelligence lab as the front face to our R&D teams over all product, pan-Baxter. 
 
  As a key member of the Technical Intelligence Center, the Business Analyst will engage with global multi-functional teams and workstreams to provide input on development and implementation tasks while working closely with Product Owners, Software Developers, Administrators, Solution Architects, and Testers. The BA will possess proven business insight needed to identify, evaluate, develop, and/or redesign systems and procedures to meet user requirements. The role will provide consultation to the business on process redesign, build detailed written user requirements for developers, support build functionality, create test scenarios, implement testing, document end-to-end process flows, and create training modules and job aids as necessary. 
 
  Are you motivated by our mission of saving and sustaining lives? 
 
  This is a remote position, where the preferred time zone is Central Standard Time. 
 
  Your Team 
 
  The Care Communications team empowers hospital employees by providing enhanced communication systems including Nurse Call systems, Alert & Alarm management, smart beds, patient and patient family communication systems, and more. 
  Baxter offers dental and medical insurance, paid time off, parental leave, 401k match, paid holidays, and more! 
 
 
  What You'll Be Doing 
 
  Conducting business analysis to identify business problems and opportunities. 
  Collaborating with stakeholders to identify and define business requirements and objectives. 
  Developing detailed business process models, flowcharts, and diagrams to illustrate business processes and requirements. 
  Evaluating and assessing existing business processes and systems to identify areas for improvement. 
  Developing and documenting cases, and functional requirements. 
  Facilitating meetings with stakeholders to capture requirements and prioritize business needs. 
  Performing data analysis and crafting reports to support decision-making. 
  Developing test cases and test plans to ensure that business requirements are met. 
  Supporting the development and implementation of new systems and processes. 
  Communicating optimally with stakeholders to ensure project success and user adoption. 
  Travel 0-10%. 
 
 
  What you'll bring 
 
  Bachelor's degree in business administration, computer science, engineering, healthcare required. 
  2+ years of business analytics experience required. 
 
 
  We understand compensation is an important factor as you consider the next step in your career. At Baxter, we are committed to equitable pay for all employees, and we strive to be more transparent with our pay practices. The estimated base salary for this position is $68,000 to $156,000 annually. The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position. We may pay more or less than of the anticipated range based upon market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on upon location, skills and expertise, experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, our pay philosophy, and available benefits, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply and are selected for an interview. 
 
  The successful candidate for this job may be required to verify that he or she has been vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to reasonable accommodations for individuals with medical conditions or religious beliefs that prevent vaccination, and in accordance with applicable law. 
 
  Equal Employment Opportunity 
 
  Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.    EEO is the Law  EEO is the law - Poster Supplement  Pay Transparency Policy 
 
  Reasonable Accommodations    Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information. 
 
  Recruitment Fraud Notice    Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.  111447
   #LI-Remote

302c991f3ba3c35c.title: Sr Analyst, Healthcare Analytics - REMOTE
302c991f3ba3c35c.desc:
JOB DESCRIPTION 
 
  Job Summary 
 
  Performs research and analysis of complex healthcare claims data, pharmacy data, and lab data regarding network utilization and cost containment information. Evaluates, writes, and presents healthcare utilization and cost containment reports and makes recommendations based on relevant findings. 
 
  KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES 
 
  Develop ad-hoc reports using SQL programming, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Medinsight, RxNavigator, Crystal Reports, Executive Dashboard, and other analytic / programming tools as needed. 
 
  Generate and distribute standard reports on schedule using SQL, Excel, and other reporting software. 
 
  Create new databases and reporting tools for monitoring, tracking and trending based on project specifications. 
 
  Collects and documents report / programming requirements from requestors to ensure appropriate creation of reports and analyses. Uses peer-to-peer review process and end-user consultation to reduce report writing errors and rework. 
 
  Responsible for timely completion of projects, including timeline development and maintenance; coordinates activities and data collection with requesting internal departments or external requestors. 
 
  Identify and complete report enhancements/fixes; modify reports in response to approved change requests; retain old and new report design for audit trail purposes. 
 
  Analyze data sets and trends for anomalies, outliers, trend changes and opportunities, using statistical tools and techniques to determine significance and relevance. Utilize extrapolation, interpolation, and other statistical methodologies to predict future trends in cost, utilization and performance. Provide executive summary of findings to requestors. 
 
  Create comprehensive workflows for the production and distribution of assigned reports, document reporting processes and procedures. 
 
  Assist with research, development and completion of special projects as requested by various internal departments, or in support of requests from regulatory agencies, contracting agencies, or other external organizations. 
 
  Maintains SharePoint Sites as needed. 
 
  JOB QUALIFICATIONS 
 
  Required Education 
 
  Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science 
 
  Required Experience 
 
  5-7 years increasingly complex database and data management responsibilities 
 
  5-7 years of increasingly complex experience in quantifying, measuring, and analyzing financial/performance management metrics 
 
  Demonstrate Healthcare experience in Quantifying, Measuring and Analyzing Financial and Utilization Metrics of Healthcare 
 
  Basic knowledge of SQL 
 
  Preferred Education 
 
  Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Math, or Computer Science 
 
  Preferred Experience 
 
  Preferred experience in Medical Economics and Strong Knowledge of Performance Indicators: 
 
  Proactively identify and investigate complex suspect areas regarding medical cost issues 
 
  Initiate in-depth analysis of the suspect/problem areas and suggest a corrective action plan 
 
  Apply investigative skill and analytical methods to look behind the numbers, assess business impacts, and make recommendations through use of healthcare analytics, predictive modeling, etc. 
 
  Analysis and forecasting of trends in medical costs to provide analytic support for finance, pricing and actuarial functions 
 
  Healthcare Analyst I or Financial/Accounting Analyst I experience desired 
 
  Multiple data systems and models 
 
  BI tools 
 
 
 Pay Range:  $66,456 - $129,590 
 
 
 
 Actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level. 
 
 To all current Molina employees:  If you are interested in applying for this position, please apply through the intranet job listing. 
 
  Molina Healthcare offers a competitive benefits and compensation package. Molina Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) M/F/D/V.

1c2aff9d591d2fea.title: Senior Financial Analyst, remote
1c2aff9d591d2fea.desc:
Senior Financial Analyst, remote  - (3259917)
  
 
 
  Mass General Brigham Health Plan is an exciting place to be within the healthcare industry. As a member of Mass General Brigham, we are on the forefront of transformation with one of the world’s leading integrated healthcare systems. Together, we are providing our members with innovative solutions centered on their health needs to expand access to seamless and affordable care and coverage. 
  Our work centers on creating an exceptional member experience – a commitment that starts with our employees. Working with some of the most accomplished professionals in healthcare today, our employees have opportunities to learn and contribute expertise within a consciously inclusive environment where diversity is celebrated. 
  We are pleased to offer competitive salaries, and a benefits package with flexible work options, career growth opportunities, and much more. 
  The Senior Financial Analyst provides value-added analytic support to Provider Network Management (PNM) in meeting Mass General Brigham Health Plan’s strategic objectives. S/he possesses in-depth knowledge of contracting and risk-sharing models and regulatory issues governing payments to providers. S/he independently designs and performs analyses to measure the financial impact of provider contracts and contract changes. In addition, s/he effectively partners with Finance and PNM staff and managers in support of specific contract negotiations as well as broader network-wide payment models. 
 
 
  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 
 
 
 Works collaboratively with PNM staff and managers in support of contract negotiation and other provider payment changes 
  o Gathers and analyzes information from multiple sources to develop a “profile” of the provider/facility facilitating a more robust contracting conversation
     o Identifies opportunities for improved savings and payment models to better align provider incentives
     o Translates business objectives into data queries and analytic models
     o Actively participates in strategy discussions with PNM and finance colleagues in discussions regarding the overall direction and objectives for specific contracts
     o Effectively interprets data and communicates findings/recommendations both orally and in writing appropriate to the audience
     o Actively participates in external provider contract meetings with PNM colleagues
    
 
 Designs and executes complex data queries and analyses to evaluate the impact of proposed and actual contractual changes. Models various scenarios to assist PNM staff in understanding options in contracting models 
 Develops ongoing means to monitor the financial/cost impact of new and existing contracts and other payment changes, including global payment and risk-sharing arrangements 
 Proactively identifies opportunities to improve Mass General Brigham Health Plan’s financial position through enhanced payment arrangements 
 Work collaboratively with the Actuarial Team in support of ongoing Trend Analysis 
  o Design and execute queries to identify drivers of change in unit cost
     o Analyze data and quantify impact of unit cost on overall medical cost trend by category of care and by product/line of business
    
 
 Designs and executes queries and develops reports in support of state and federal regulatory requirements 
 Collaborates with finance and budget staff in quantifying the impact of contract savings on overall medical expenses and trends 
 Ensures the validity and accuracy of all data/information reported and presented 
 Works collaboratively with IT to: enhance automation of processes; establish data warehouse standards and definitions; and to identify new tools to facilitate standard querying and reporting 
 Anticipates and meets, or exceeds, internal and/or external customer expectations and requirements; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect 
 Hold self and others accountable to meet commitments. 
 Ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion are integrated as a guiding principle. 
 Persist in accomplishing objectives, despite obstacles and setbacks, to consistently achieve results. 
 Build strong relationships and infrastructures that designate Mass General Brigham Health Plan as a people-first organization. 
 
 
 
 Other duties as assigned with or without accommodation. 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications: 
  The ideal candidate has an analytical mindset with the ability to think critically to understand how to pull data and design analyses to support provider contract pricing. 
 
  Required: 
 
 
 Bachelor’s Degree in a related field 
 
 
 
 4-6 years of analytic and/or IT experience in healthcare 
 2-3 years prior experience working with and analyzing Commercial claims data using SQL 
 
  Preferred/Desired: 
 
 
 Master’s Degree in related field 
 
  KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE, SKILLS 
 
 Possess strong analytic and technical skills and the ability to translate complicated data into useable information 
 In-depth knowledge and understanding of health care claims data, coding schemes (e.g. ICD, CPT) grouping methodologies (e.g. DRG, EAPG), and risk adjustment 
 Demonstrated knowledge of managed care concepts and the financial relationship between payors and providers 
 In-depth knowledge and understanding of the various payment methodologies and types of contractual relationships payors have with providers, including global and bundled payments and risk-sharing arrangements 
 Demonstrated knowledge of database and data structures as well as of general systems technology 
 
    SKILLS/COMPETENCIES 
 
 Organizational and project management skills to manage projects effectively; ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously 
 Ability to conduct analytic work in an efficient manner with minimal re-work including effective use of the peer review process 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills; outstanding interpersonal skills; the ability to relate positively with individuals at all levels both internally at Mass General Brigham Health Plan and externally with providers 
 Creative, flexible, and self-motivated with sound judgment 
 Respects the talent and unique contribution of every individual, culture and ethnic group and treats all people in a fair and equitable manner 
 Exercises self-awareness; monitors impact on others 
 Receptive to and seeks out feedback; uses self-discipline to adjust to feedback 
 Demonstrate Mass General Brigham Health Plan's core brand principles of always listening, challenging conventions, and providing value. 
 Respect the talent and unique contribution of every individual, and treat all people in a fair and equitable manner. 
 Exercise self-awareness; monitor impact on others; be receptive to and seek out feedback; use self-discipline to adjust to feedback. 
 Be accountable for delivering high-quality work. Act with a clear sense of ownership. 
 Bring fresh ideas forward by actively listening to and working with employees and the people we serve. 
 
    OTHER SKILLS 
 
 Advanced Excel programming 
 
    INDEPENDENT ACTION  The majority of work is conducted with minimal oversight or supervision. The Sr. Analyst independently designs and executes data queries, analyzes and interprets findings, and presents results to manager and director-level staff. When data appear out of the expected range, the Sr. Analyst independently investigates and presents findings to the supervisor, as needed. 
 
 ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS/SCOPE  The Senior Financial Analyst works collaboratively with staff, managers, and directors in Finance, Provider Network Management, and Clinical Services. In addition, the Sr. Analyst will interact with Mass General Brigham Health Plan Executives and externally, with individuals from our provider network. 
 
 
 
 
  EEO Statement 
 
  Mass General Brigham is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, military service, genetic information, and/or other status protected under law. We will ensure that all individuals with a disability are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. 
 
 
 
 
 
  Primary Location  MA-Somerville-MGB Health Plan at Assembly Row
  
 
  Work Locations  MGB Health Plan at Assembly Row 399 Revolution Drive Somerville 02145
  
 
  Job  Finance/Accounting
  
 
  Organization  Mass General Brigham Health Plan
  
 
  Schedule  Full-time
  
 
  Standard Hours  40
  
 
  Shift  Day Job
  
 
  Employee Status  Regular
  
 
  Recruiting Department  MGB Health Plan Actuarial
  
 
  Job Posting  Sep 20, 2023

44736bac7b2a7ee4.title: Data Visualization Specialist - Secret Clearance required
44736bac7b2a7ee4.desc:
Role: Data Analyst/Scientist (Data Visualization with Tableau or PowerBI) Location: Remote Type: Full Time  Clearance: Secret Clearance (TS Eligible) 
 We are looking for energetic, self-starting, detail-oriented team members for our data analytics project in support of the US Department of State. We have available positions for mid-level Data Scientists and Visualization specialists, especially those with experience in supporting federal clients, financial data, PowerBI, Databricks, and Azure. These individuals will be responsible for assisting the Senior Data Scientist in developing a new data-based solution for our customer. 
 Duties will include: 
 ● Data cleaning, transforming, and modeling of raw data; 
 ● Building visualizations of the transformed and modeled data into interactive dashboards; and 
 ● Assisting teammates with Machine Learning and AI for developing predictive analysis. 
 Required qualifications will include: 
 ● Minimum of 3 years performing exploratory data analysis to understand the characteristics of a data set and identify potential issues. 
 ● Demonstrated experience of efficient manipulation and wrangling of large datasets. 
 ● Hands on experience and expertise with PowerBI, Databricks, Tableau, R, and Python. 
 ● Comfortable dealing with ambiguity, making assumptions, drawing conclusions, and distilling complex analysis for non-technical audiences. 
 ● Strong data visualization skills (PowerBI and Tableau, preferred). 
 ● Experience with data warehousing and knowledge of ETL/ELT best practices. 
 ● Familiarity with Azure toolsets. 
 ● Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, high-energy environment with shifting priorities. 
 ● Outstanding communication skills and a good team player. 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Pay: $96,293.61 - $160,966.50 per year 
 Benefits: 
 
 401(k) 
 Dental insurance 
 Health insurance 
 
 Experience level: 
 
 3 years 
 
 Schedule: 
 
 8 hour shift 
 Day shift 
 Monday to Friday 
 
 Application Question(s): 
 
 What Data Visualization tools have you worked with? 
 Do you have experience with Databricks? 
 Do you have experience with Aure? 
 Are you a U.S. Citizen? 
 What is the salary you are looking for? 
 
 Experience: 
 
 Data Analysis: 3 years (Preferred) 
 
 Security clearance: 
 
 Secret (Preferred) 
 
 Work Location: Remote

2740429f4192c5d1.title: Senior Lead Business Analyst (Remote)
2740429f4192c5d1.desc:
Company Description
   Job Description 
  The Sr. Business Analyst will work within the A&F IT and business community to ensure systems meet the business requirements of the user community with emphasis on Technology Services and Corporate Applications. The Sr. Business Analyst will coordinate and lead project team meetings, analyze IT and business processes, and help design and implement improvements for the organization. 
  What Will You Be Doing? 
 
  Clearly understands the end user’s needs related to the product by working closely with Product Owners, Functional Leads, SMEs, and other cross-functional business partners. 
  Participates and collaborates in user discovery sessions and project team meetings to gather and organize project business requirements and use cases on assigned project. 
  Conduct current and future state reviews, capturing initial requirements and project assumptions as required during Idea and Concepting Phases with the PPM, Tech Leads and Enterprise Architects 
  Works with Business Leads, IT Application Leads and Enterprise Architects to craft initial Feature Maps and sizing for use with initial project and resource plans. 
  Documents necessary business rules and logic through process flows, journey maps, system context diagrams, business workflows, excel matrices, visuals, etc. 
  Partners with technical teams to ensure Feature and User stories are written at appropriate level. 
  Work with project leaders, architects, and application teams to determine the right technical solutions that meet the business requirements. 
  Coordinates work with Scrum Masters and Team BA’s; assists with story acceptance criteria to ensure fulfillment of business requirements and IT quality, architectural, and security standards. 
  Capable of developing Leadership skills in others through direct reports and mentoring. 
  Work closely with the quality assurance team, sharing knowledge / understanding of requirements and acceptance criteria. 
 
  What Do You Need To Bring? 
 
  Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, MIS/CIS, Engineering, or related field 
  2-3 years of professional experience in Business Analyst work, particularly in Agile, preferred. 
  Strong Business Analyst skills, preferably with Agile experience 
  Strong interpersonal skills including collaboration, facilitation, leadership, and negotiation. 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills to facilitate cross-cultural communication between and among highly experienced business and IT associates. 
  Excellent analytical skills with the ability to understand and effectively communicate complex business and technical processes, problems, and issues. 
  Excellent planning and organizational skills; capable of managing multiple projects/tasks in parallel 
  Ability to understand the long-term ("big picture") and short term perspectives of situations. 
 
  Our Company 
  Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) is a global retailer of five iconic, omnichannel lifestyle brands catering to the kid through millennial customer: Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, Hollister, Gilly Hicks and Social Tourist. At A&F Co., we’re here for our associates, customers and communities on the journey to being and becoming who they are – and because no journey is the same, we strive to create an inclusive culture, where everyone is free to share ideas. 
  Our Values 
  We lead with purpose and always put our people first, which is evidenced by our Great Place to Work™ Certification, as well as being a 2021 recipient of Fortune’s Best Workplaces in Retail, and named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign for 16 consecutive years. We’re proud to offer equitable compensation and benefits, including flexibility and competitive Paid Time Off, as well as education and engagement events, including various Associate Resource Groups, volunteer opportunities and additional time off to give back to our global communities. 
  What You'll Get 
  As an Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) associate, you’ll be eligible to participate in a variety of benefit programs designed to fit you and your lifestyle. A&F is committed to providing simple, competitive, and comprehensive benefits that align with our Company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! We also provide competitive incentives to reward the commitment our associates have for moving our global business forward: 
 
  Incentive Bonus Program 
  Paid Time Off and Work From Anywhere Flexibility 
  Paid Volunteer Day per Year, allowing you to give back to your community 
  Merchandise Discount 
  Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Available 
  Life and Disability Insurance 
  Associate Assistance Program 
  Paid Parental and Adoption Leave 
  Access to Carrot to support your unique parenthood journey 
  Access to Headspace dedicated to creating healthier, happier lives from the inside out 
  401(K) Savings Plan with Company Match 
  Opportunities for Career Advancement, we believe in promoting from within 
  A Global Team of People Who'll Celebrate you for Being YOU 
 
 
 
 
 Additional Information
   ABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER 
  Notice (For Colorado, New York, California and Washington): The recruiting pay range for this position is $100,000 - $110,000. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, your years of experience, your work location, comparison to other employees in similar or related roles, or market demands. The range may be modified in the future.

1a861c453a672a8e.title: Associate Marketing Operations Analyst
1a861c453a672a8e.desc:
Acquia empowers the world's most ambitious brands to create digital customer experiences that matter. With open source Drupal at its core, the Acquia Digital Experience Platform (DXP) enables marketers, developers, and IT operations teams at thousands of global organizations to rapidly compose and deploy digital products and services that engage customers, enhance conversions, and help businesses stand out. 
  Headquartered in the U.S., Acquia has been named a top software company by The Software Report, rated a leader by the analyst community, and named a top place to work by the Boston Globe and the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future and we want you to be a part of it! 
  The Marketing Operations Analyst is responsible for supporting the marketing team with data analysis, reporting, and campaign execution. This role will also be responsible for developing and maintaining marketing databases and systems. 
  Responsibilities: 
 
 Gather and analyze data to track marketing performance and identify trends. 
 Develop and manage marketing reports and dashboards. 
 Create and maintain metrics reports on marketing and sales activities, effectiveness and business impact 
 Support the marketing team with campaign execution. 
 Provide recommendations that enhance future campaign performance and measurements 
 Develop and maintain marketing databases and systems. 
 Assist with marketing research and analysis. 
 Other duties as assigned. 
 
 Qualifications:

4262c5315981c159.title: Lead Business Analyst
4262c5315981c159.desc:
About 
  Since 2005, Crystal Management provides information technology (IT) infrastructure, systems integration, cybersecurity, facility design and transition, and professional services to customers in the defense, civilian federal agencies, homeland security, intelligence, and commercial sectors. We understand the mission demands innovative approaches, technology, and people. With talented professionals deployed worldwide, Crystal Management delivers IT enterprise solutions, systems engineering, and management consulting services for the largest transformation and restationing programs in defense history. Crystal Management is a service-disabled veteran-owned small business. 
  Position Summary 
  As the Lead Business Analyst for our Peace Corps program, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. You will lead a team that includes the Sr ServiceNow Developer, collaborating closely to gather insights and recommendations instrumental in driving improvements, streamlining processes, and ensuring the successful implementation of technology solutions. 
  Responsibilities 
 
  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and understand business processes to design, develop, and implement effective ServiceNow solutions. 
  Lead the analysis of business objectives, processes, and requirements, ensuring clear documentation and alignment with project goals. 
  Work closely with the ServiceNow Developer to translate business requirements into effective technical solutions within the ServiceNow platform. 
  Customize and configure ServiceNow to meet the unique needs of the Peace Corps, ensuring optimal functionality and user experience. 
  Develop, test, and deploy new modules, applications, and workflows within the ServiceNow platform, collaborating with the ServiceNow Developer and other relevant teams. 
  Lead user acceptance testing (UAT) efforts to ensure that solutions meet business requirements. 
  Maintain and enhance existing ServiceNow configurations, workflows, and integrations to ensure ongoing system performance and reliability. 
  Collaborate with other developers and administrators to ensure seamless integration between ServiceNow and other systems and platforms. 
  Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure code quality and best practices. 
  Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to the ServiceNow platform, working with the IT support team as needed. 
  Stay up-to-date with the latest ServiceNow developments, features, and best practices to continually enhance the platform's capabilities. 
  Document technical specifications, processes, and procedures for future reference and knowledge sharing. 
 
  Education/Certifications 
 
  Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or related field preferred. 
  ServiceNow certifications, such as Certified Application Developer (CAD) or Certified System Administrator (CSA) preferred. 
 
  Required Qualifications 
 
  Proven experience as a Business Analyst, with a minimum of 5 years in a leadership or senior role. 
  Strong understanding of business analysis methodologies, tools, and best practices. 
  Proficiency in documenting business requirements, use cases, and process flows. 
  Experience working on technology projects and collaborating with development teams. 
  Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels. 
  Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work independently in a fast-paced environment. 
 
  Preferred Skills 
 
  Experience working in Agile/Scrum development environments. 
  Knowledge of integration between ServiceNow and other third-party systems. 
  Familiarity with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and other web development technologies. 
 
  Clearance Requirements 
 
  Eligibility to obtain a public trust clearance with the Peace Corps. 
 
  COVID-19 Safety Protocols: To protect the health and safety of its employees and to comply with customer requirements, employees in certain positions may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or subject to facility entry safety protocols (e.g., testing, masking, physical distancing), subject to the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements. 
  Crystal Management, LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. 
  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. 
  #NowHiring 
  #CoronaVirusHiring

f695a4b0573cf5fd.title: Sr. Business Analyst - Remote
f695a4b0573cf5fd.desc:
Job Description:
  
 
   Sharecare is the leading digital health company that helps people – no matter where they are in their health journey – unify and manage all their health in one place. Our comprehensive and data-driven virtual health platform is designed to help people, providers, employers, health plans, government organizations, and communities optimize individual and population-wide well-being by driving positive behavior change. Driven by our philosophy that we are all together better, at Sharecare, we are committed to supporting each individual through the lens of their personal health and making high-quality care more accessible and affordable for everyone. To learn more, visit 
   
   www.sharecare.com
   .
  
 
 
   Job Summary:
  
 
 
   The Senior Business Analyst is the liaison between colleagues with business needs and the technical team members who are responsible for creating solutions to meet those needs. This position reports to the Director of Product Management and works with individuals across Sharecare’s business and client portfolio to analyze and reengineer complex processes, develop and document requirements and process flows, implement total solutions, and be a role model for effective communication and facilitation. This individual's responsibilities include participating on a variety of highly visible cross-functional project teams, meeting with relevant stakeholders, analyzing information, collaborating to capture business documentation that clearly articulates objectives in formats that are useful to business area experts and technical colleagues, leading the design of new and/or re-engineered processes and providing expertise in corporately adopted standards and tools. By participating in process and system reengineering, the Senior Business Analyst will improve the reliability and credibility of Sharecare’s processes and solutions.
  
 
 
  The Senior Business Analyst designs and rearticulates complex financial solutions. The ideal candidate will have all the requisite experience to manage these responsibilities, five plus years of experience as a Business Analyst, and a minimum of five years of technical and operational programming experience. The ideal candidate will also have the ability to manage multiple high-visibility projects concurrently and will have the ability to develop and articulate written business definitions and documents.
  
 
 
   Essential Job Functions:
  
 
 
 
     Conduct research to develop a thorough understanding of identified business needs.
    
 
 
     Act as the lead agent to coordinate full project discovery that includes interviewing relevant stakeholders and end-users
    
 
 
     Facilitate meetings with stakeholders and end-users as a change agent to remove roadblocks and gain agreement.
    
 
 
     Analyze business processes, tools, and data while applying critical thinking to realize the most appropriate resolution.
    
 
 
     Identify and lead project team members to consensus on project scope.
    
 
 
     Collaborate with project team members in providing recommendations related to the most effective, highest quality, most appropriate solution; utilize conflict management skills in negotiating agreements among all parties.
    
 
 
     Demonstrate superb decision-making skills by engaging experts while determining alternatives.
    
 
 
     Document requirements and specifications relating to recommended solutions.
    
 
 
 
       Support creation of Project Charters and provide associated estimates.
      
 
 
       Generate meeting agendas, minutes, and action plans as appropriate.
      
 
 
       Generate documentation that clearly articulates the objectives, scope, and requirements to all relevant colleagues.
      
 
 
 
         Utilize corporate standards and tools to capture business requirements, functional and non-functional requirements, use cases, process flows and activity diagrams; train, lead and mentor others in completion of these tasks.
        
 
 
         Plan an approach for documenting, categorizing, and packaging requirements that satisfies all parties.
        
 
 
         Design and support staffing of large initiatives requiring these skills.
        
 
 
 
  Verify business and functional requirements are traceable to solution specifications.
      
 
 
       Verify business and functional requirements are testable; generate testing objectives.
      
 
 
       Generate detailed user requirements supported by narratives, work catalog summary, use cases/diagrams & business modeling.
      
 
 
       If there is in whole or in part a process solution, generate detailed process flows.
      
 
 
       Communicate assimilated requirements and specifications in standard formats that are useful to business area experts and technical colleagues.
      
 
 
 
  Lead the effort with stakeholders to design new or reengineer existing business processes to effect solutions.
    
 
 
 
       Utilize process analysis/design expertise to design new or reengineer existing processes to implement new or changed procedures, eliminate duplicate effort, reduce errors, and increase efficiency and effectiveness; ensure seamless integration.
      
 
 
       Collaborate with project team members to identify problems and opportunities within existing processes.
      
 
 
       Oversee documentation, user training, and implementation of new processes.
      
 
 
       Identify future process improvement initiatives where applicable and assist in the prioritization of those initiatives by quantifying needs and benefits.
      
 
 
 
  Manage multiple highly visible projects within agreed-upon work allocations.
    
 
 
 
       Generate and manage child project plans that relate to assigned projects.
      
 
 
       Generate routine project status reports in the form and at times requested by management.
      
 
 
 
 
   Specific Skills/ Attributes:
  
 
 
 
     Ability to project manage multiple high-visibility projects concurrently.
    
 
 
     Ability to develop and articulate written business definitions and documents.
    
 
 
     Ability to understand information quickly, derive insight, synthesize information clearly and concisely, and devise solutions.
    
 
 
     Ability to manage and thrive in a matrix environment.
    
 
 
     Inclination to take initiative, set strategic priorities, take ownership of assigned projects and initiatives, and independently drive for results.
    
 
 
     Excellent communication skills and the ability to interface at all levels of the organization within and outside of the company.
    
 
 
     Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills.
    
 
 
     Excellent organizational skills.
    
 
 
     Strong orientation to detail.
    
 
 
     Superb relationship-building and interpersonal skills.
    
 
 
     Strong meeting facilitation skills.
    
 
 
     Ability to create and implement business strategies and processes.
    
 
 
     Demonstrated self-confidence, honesty, and integrity.
    
 
 
     Understand and commit to the philosophy, mission, values, and vision of Sharecare
    
 
 
     Ability to travel as business needs require. (minimal)
    
 
 
 
   Qualifications:
  
 
 
 
     Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in healthcare, information systems or related field required.
    
 
 
     5+ years of Business Analyst experience or similar experience as detailed above in the responsibilities section of this job description.
    
 
 
     5+ years of operations/technical programming experience.
    
 
 
     2+ years’ experience working with financial systems required
    
 
 
     Experience working in healthcare is preferred, but not required.
    
 
 
     Certifications in business analysis, project management, product development lifecycle, process engineering, or process management are a plus.
    
 
 
     Understanding and experience with application development methodologies.
    
 
 
 
   Sharecare and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E-Verify users. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, equal pay, disability, genetic information, protected veteran status, or other status protected under applicable law.

f89a2bcfd72f90e5.title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
f89a2bcfd72f90e5.desc:
The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst ensures the integrity, consistency and scalability of CDW’s Integrated tech reporting and provides insightful analysis to support executive leadership’s decision making. This role designs and develops reporting, analyzes business processes, and aligns projects with the executive strategy. The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst aligns all tactical and strategic priorities with Integrated Tech leadership initiatives. 
 
 Key Areas of Responsibility 
 
 Design actionable reporting tools that enable Integrated tech leaders to make data driven decisions 
 Produce sound analysis from large data sets and provide recommendations to Integrated tech leadership to drive tactical and strategic objectives and partnership decisions 
 Communicate analysis and key findings to leaders clearly, concisely and timely 
 Collaborate with stakeholders to clarify, prioritize and validate project requirements and business objectives  
 Be a change management champion 
 Balance multiple projects with the ability to prioritize based on business needs 
 Serve as a conduit/broker for cross-functional collaboration and knowledge sharing 
 Conduct a variety of ad-hoc analysis based on business needs  
 Conduct impact analysis as needed for logic changes implemented in reporting tools 
 Establish and maintain data governance processes and strategies to minimize data integrity and business risk 
 Report data using SQL and Power BI in an Enterprise Data Warehouse environment 
 Evaluate ways to improve processes to streamline data delivery and implement innovative process improvement changes 
 Provide thought leadership on ways to improve or reduce friction in data-heavy processes and automation  
 Act as a liaison between the business and IT on all technical Integrated Tech projects 
 Deliver content using innovative tools 
 
   
 Required Qualifications 
 
 Bachelor's Degree or the equivalent in experience  
 5+ years analyst experience with sales analysis, financial analysis, econometrics, or statistics 
 Microsoft Power Platform experience, including Power BI experience, and Power Apps or Power Automate experience 
 SQL Server Management experience 
 Excellent analytical skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze large volumes of raw data, draw conclusions, and develops actionable recommendations.  
 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills with experience effectively presenting to executives (examples of written communication to be provided) 
 Strong editorial skills with acute attention to detail (will be tested) 
 Strong process improvement skills  
 History of balancing multiple time-sensitive priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlines 
 Proven ability to build and maintain strong cross functional relationships 
 Self-starter with ability to work independently 
 Project management experience 
 Expert-level Excel skills 
 Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, including MS Project- 
 
 Preferred Qualifications 
 
 MBA 
 Six Sigma Certification 
 PMP certification preferred. 
 Data warehouse experience

b28cbb60c8fe45a3.title: Principal Business Intelligence Analyst
b28cbb60c8fe45a3.desc:
See yourself at Twilio 
  Join the team as Twilio's next Principal Business Intelligence Analyst! 
  Who we are & why we're hiring 
  Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer experiences. 
  Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we have presence throughout South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. We're on a journey to becoming a global company that actively opposes racism and all forms of oppression and bias. At Twilio, we support diversity, equity & inclusion wherever we do business. 
  About the job 
  This position is needed to fuel insights and strategic decisions that drive measurable growth across Twilio websites and core products. You will be responsible for analytics across our global websites to provide a deeper understanding of the behavior and interests of web visitors, prospects, and customers worldwide. You will build and implement a robust web measurement framework while managing our GA4 implementation to ensure stakeholders can continually track the impact of their launches, optimizations, A/B tests, personalized experiences, and design decisions. You will be part of a highly visible Strategy & Analytics team that serves as a trusted advisor to leadership for measurement, forensics, and insights across the entire customer journey. Collaborate with great minds across Web, Marketing, Product, Growth Engineering, Corporate Communications, and Sales to implement end-to-end web analytics solutions that have direct impact on Twilio's growth. 
  Responsibilities 
  In this role, you'll: 
 
 Design and implement a robust web measurement framework across Twilio's global websites 
 Monitor and analyze website performance to ensure everything is functioning as expected 
 Lead and manage our global Google Analytics 4 implementation 
 Develop mechanisms for scalable, uniform data capture through tag management platforms in collaboration with Web Engineering 
 Generate insights and opportunities based on data to improve site performance and user experience 
 Build dashboards, reports, and forecasts to help stakeholders understand historical and projected website performance 
 Monitor the health of our website and communicate storylines at a weekly cadence to leadership 
 Conduct quantitative analysis to inform strategic decisions 
 Build a robust web analytics ecosystem to empower stakeholders to leverage web data based on your documentation, training, video guides, office hours, and more 
 
 Qualifications 
  Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having "desired" qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table! 
  Required: 
 
 7+ years of experience in analytics, marketing, business, or another quantitative field 
 Deep technical expertise as it pertains to web analytics architecture, data capture, and advanced analytics 
 Demonstrated ability to monitor, assess, and act upon large volumes of data to craft data-driven strategies 
 Ability to translate complex technical details into understandable concepts for stakeholders and non-technical audiences 
 Experience monitoring and interpreting key performance as it pertains to website traffic, engagement, user experience, and conversions 
 Familiarity implementing and managing Google Analytics 
 Experience working as an analytics partner to technical and non-technical stakeholders 
 
 Desired: 
 
 Deep familiarity with web analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, and CDPs 
 Experience with data visualization platforms such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Data Studio, etc 
 Experience with optimization tools such as Adobe Target, Google Optimize, Optimizely, etc 
 Ability to oversee and guide A/B testing methodologies for appropriate measurement 
 Proven ability to collaborate with leadership across marketing, analytics, and business stakeholders 
 
 Location 
  This role will be remote in the United States. Approximately 5% travel is anticipated. 
  What We Offer 
  There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary by location. 
  Twilio thinks big. Do you? 
  We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody our values — something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their volunteering and donation efforts. 
  So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be the best version of yourself, apply now! 
  If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open positions. 
 
 Please note this role is open to candidates outside of Colorado, California, New York, and Washington. The information below is provided for candidates hired in those locations only. 
 
  The estimated pay ranges for this role are as follows: 
 
 Based in Colorado: $132,320 - $165,400.   
 Based in New York, Washington State or California (outside the San Francisco Bay Area): $140,080 - $175,100.   
 Based in the San Francisco Bay area, California: $155,600 - $194,500.   
 This role may be eligible to participate in Twilio's equity plan. All roles are eligible for the following benefits: health care insurance, 401(k) retirement account, paid sick time, paid personal time off, paid parental leave.   
 
 The successful candidate's starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location within the state. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  Twilio is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Additionally, Twilio participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. 
  Twilio is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommodation@twilio.com.

aad9350be2e9f43b.title: Senior Technical Business Analyst (360)
aad9350be2e9f43b.desc:
ABOUT THE COMPANY 
  Amplify Consulting Partners is a data-first consulting company trusted by Fortune 500 businesses to deliver high-impact professional services across the technology ecosystem—from data engineering and visual analytics to data-driven marketing and program management. 
  We build and empower high-performing people by promoting growth and connection across our company culture. We don't just hang core values on the wall, we make every decision with them in mind—developing trusted, long-term relationships on a foundation of transparency and accountability. 
   ABOUT THE ROLE 
  The Architecture & Innovation team is responsible for driving technology strategies, innovations and architectures that support every aspect of our global business. We work in a highly matrixed environment alongside business & technology leaders, and guidance to delivery teams to collaboratively develop and deliver strategic plans, roadmaps & solutioning that unlock lululemon’s strategic goals and outcomes. 
 
 Collaborate with Architects/users to understand and anticipate their needs and translate them into product requirements. 
  Create a product roadmap & partner with cross-functional teams in the delivery of roadmap features & capabilities. 
  Manage day to day operations, configuration & continuous improvement of the applications used by Architecture teams.  
 Deliver reporting & data visualization solutions via Power BI and/or other solutions. 
  Performs functional solution and design with understanding of process, data and system flows to facilitate design decisions within a functional domain. 
  Has a strong sense of ownership with the ability to drive clarity in complex and ambiguous scenarios. 
  Proficient with systems-thinking and able to articulate them to various stakeholder groups.  
 Provides technical oversight and guides teams to resolve technical issues. 
  Supports one or more complex business processes.  
 Serves as a team member, sometimes as a technical analyst and systems administrator.  
 Cross functional support on solving complex technical problems. 
  Drives partnership with fellow team members to share knowledge, documentation, and alignment to new solutions. 
 
  QUALIFICATIONS 
 
  Must be local to the greater Seattle area and willing to go into an awesome downtown office (on 2nd Avenue) twice a week 
  Bachelor’s degree in computer systems/science/engineering/information technology or equivalent 
  Possess understanding of product management in context of software development practices and life cycles. 
  Strong Project/Program Management skills including management of scope, schedule, risks & issues. 
  Experience with systems/application implementation & supporting day to day operations. 
  5+years of work experience in information technology with solid experience working on enterprise architecture and innovation management tools & systems, including Power BI or other reporting tools.  
 Prior experience supporting Enterprise Architecture and/or Innovation Management software applications preferred, but not required.  
 
 ie: LEANix, Orbus, Avolution for Enterprise Architecture 
  ie: Hype, QMartkets, Itonics for Innovation Management 
 
  Proven track record of delivering and supporting complex systems with hands-on experience ranging from designing and architecting, building for scale and testing for performance & quality. 
  Developing and implementing test plans & remediation activities. 
  Possess strong team player skills with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Creative problem solver possessing the ability to measure and improve products and processes. 
  Self-starter with the ability to make independent decisions and the judgment to know when to seek guidance. 
  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a proven ability to work under pressure and during critical production issues. 
 
 
  MUST HAVES 
 
 
  Acknowledge the presence of choice in every moment and take personal responsibility for your life. 
  Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovate to achieve great results. 
  Communicate with honesty and kindness and create the space for others to do the same. 
  Lead with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. 
  Foster connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. 
  Integrate fun and joy as a way of being and working 
 
 
  SALARY AND BENEFIT HIGHLIGHTS 
  At Amplify we take a holistic approach to total rewards in order to invest in the satisfaction and success of our employees both now and in the future. We consider the whole person and want to support our employees in living full lives both personally and professionally. The following is an overview of what you’ll get as a member of our team.    Salary Range: We are committed to equitable and fair pay practices. For this role, the base salary pay range is $110,000 - $130,000 a year. We consider a variety of factors when making compensation decisions and generally do not hire employees at the highest point of the pay range The starting salary for this role is up to $130,000. We share this to ensure transparency, expectation-setting and education for candidates considering opportunities with us. 
 
  Remote work option (hybrid, 2 days in office/week) 
  Flexible time off (time to recharge when you need it!) 
  11 observed holidays 
  Medical/dental/vision – employee is covered at 100%, dependents are subsidized 
  Parental leave, short-term disability, long-term disability, and life insurance options 
  401k program and Amplify matching up to 3% 
  ‘Amplify You’ program – $1,000 annually for your own development or investment in well-being after one year 
  Student loan payback program 
  Mentorship and training opportunities 
  Business and employee referral bonus opportunities 
 
   OUR HIRING PRACTICES      At Amplify, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes all employees with diverse backgrounds and experience.

3a5538d6e2552ab5.title: Operations Analyst
3a5538d6e2552ab5.desc:
Operations Analyst 
 
  Who are we? 
 Versant Health is one of the nation’s leading administrators of managed vision care, serving millions of our clients’ members nationwide. We are driven by our mission to help members enjoy the wonders of sight through healthy eyes and vision. 
 
  As a Versant Health associate, you can enjoy a comprehensive Total Rewards package, which includes health and dental insurance, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) with company match, pet insurance, no-cost-to-you vision insurance for you and your qualified dependents. We are also invested in your success. There are many opportunities for advancement and development throughout all stages of your career with us. 
 
  See how you can make a difference with the support of strong leadership and a team environment. 
 
  See Everything, Be Anything™. 
 
  What are we looking for? 
 The Operations Analyst is responsible for reviewing business processes and making a variety of recommendations for improving efficiency and service. The Operations Analyst actively monitors complaint, appeal, and grievance operations and makes recommendations to the leadership about enhancing business processes and overall department structure. In addition, the Operations Analyst identifies opportunities to increase profitability and develop improved processes. 
 
  Where you will have an impact 
 
 
 Review company policies and business process 
 Analyze data and information to identify business opportunities 
 Work closely with department leadership to achieve outcomes based on company goals 
 Recommend changes to department policies and procedures to improve performance 
 Enhance workflow and cross-departmental engagements 
 Collaborate with key stakeholders to improve cost-effectiveness across all platforms 
 Works in conjunction with Utilization Management, Call Center, Claims Operations, Network Development & Operations, Information Technology, Compliance, Reporting, and Finance to support and continue to improve service delivery and quality. 
 Provide training, presentations, and facilitation 
 Create monthly reports to management on key findings and assessments 
 Continue to stay updated on industry and market trends 
 Review a broad range of business processes and related systems 
 Develop good working relationships with business sponsors, business partners, and technical staff 
 Create, validate, socialize, and execute the requirements development plan 
 Participates in client audit administrative processes to ensure that all client contractual performance guarantees are met 
 Generates daily, weekly, and monthly reporting pertinent to complaints, grievances, and appeals for the purpose of monitoring adherence to Federal and State timeliness requirements and identifying trends. 
 Handles all incoming complaints, grievances, and appeal requests in accordance with all statutory, regulatory, accreditation, and contractual requirements 
 Use exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal 
 Other duties as assigned 
  What’s necessary to do the job? 
 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in the field of Business Administration, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a similar degree preferred or equivalent work experience 
 Intermediate level with various software programs including Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, Visio, and Outlook), preferred experience with the use of Microsoft Project 
 Experience working on multiple projects concurrently 
 Minimum of 3 years relevant work experience as an analyst in a professional setting preferred 
 Knowledge and understanding of the government-sponsored health plans and public sector managed care industry, more specifically Complaints, Appeals, and Grievance business operations within Medicare Advantage plans and Medicaid Managed Care Organizations (MCOs) and their requirements highly desired 
 Requires understanding of managed care processes and terminology 
 Minimum of three (3) years of experience in complaints, grievances & appeals 
 At least two (2) years of claims and/or contracting experience in a managed care environment 
 Preferred Lean Certification/Six Sigma 
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
 Understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle 
  HIPAA & Security Requirements 
 All Associates must comply with the Health Insurance Portability Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) as it pertains to disclosures of protected health information (PHI) as described in the Notice of Privacy Practices and HIPAA Privacy Policies and Procedures. As a component of job roles and responsibilities, Associates may have access to covered information, cardholder data or other confidential customer information which must be protected at all times. As a result, Associates must explicitly adhere to all data security guidelines established within the Company’s Privacy & Security Training Program. 
 
  Versant Health will never request money from candidates who seek employment with us and will never ask for any payment as part of the recruitment process. 
 
  Versant Health is a proud Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer dedicated to attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse and inclusive workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at Versant Health without regards to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. 
 
  The wage range for applicants for this position is [$60,000.00 to $ 70,000.00]. 
 All incentives and benefits are subject to the applicable plan terms.
